User Response Definition

Version:MissionOS_2.0

User Response Definition configures the different sections/roles that people can add comments under e.g. Site observation/immediate response, technical manager.

To access the Blog Settings, open the Data Manager.

Go to Admin. Click open the Setup menu. Select the Blog Settings.

 

 

 

Blog Settings interface opens with User Response Definition preselected and open by default.

There are 5 tabs under Blog Settings:

  • User Response Definition
  • Manage Subresponses
  • Blog Post Closure
  • Review Snapshot
  • Review Report Format

 

User Response Definition allows you to add and edit the main response definition.

By default, the main response categories are available and listed in the table.

In the User Response Definition interface, the user responses appear listed in a table.

 

 

 

If you want to make changes to a specific response, perform the following steps:

  1. Click the Edit icon against the response.
    New fields populate.
  2. Change the Response Description, as needed.
  3. Select/unselect the Deactivate checkbox, if you want to deactivate/activate the user response categories from the Homepage of the portal and reports.
  4. You can also select the Set as Closure checkbox, if you want to require comments in this response category in order to close a breach. (Applicable only for Generate & Close closure method)
  5. Click Update. The Response Type gets updated successfully.

 

 

 

 

  1. Click the Refresh icon in the browser, for the changes to reflect in the Blogs section of the Homepage portal after the modifications are done.

 

To check on the updates, go to the Homepage interface of the portal,

You can see that on the right-hand side panel, the Instrument Data tab appears preselected by default.

Perform the following steps:

  1. Click the Blogs tab to add comments to the Review Reports.
  2. Click open AAA
  3. Select any Blog.
  4. Click the side arrow to open the Blog post details.
  5. Then click the down arrow at the Add button > Comment > *Current breach / *Previous breach.

 

 

 

 

 

  1. The Add Comment popup opens.

 

In the Add Comment pop-up,

  1. Click open the Response Type drop-down arrow.
    The various Response Types appear listed.
  2. Select the edited Response Type.
  3. You can see the edits done to the Response Description in Blog Settings updated in the corresponding Response Type appearing in the pop-up.

 

 

 

 

To generate a AAA review report, perform the following steps:

  1. Go to the specific Blog post.
  2. Click Reports > Generate > Current Breach.

 

 

 

  1. The Blog Custom Options pop-up opens. Select the following based on requirement:
  2. Select a different graph template from the Graph Options.
  3. Select the option Plot All Data.
  4. Click Proceed.

 

 

A Review Report Reference ID

Click Generate to open the Report in a new browser tab.

 

 

 

You can see the updated Response Type in the Report.

 

 

 

In the Blog Settings > User Response Definition interface,

Select Deactivate checkbox, and click Update.

The deactivated response type no longer displays in the Add Comments popup and the AAA Reports that appear from the Homepage of the portal.
